title: The 30 Best Skin-Care Products You Can Buy at Ulta
description: Whether you're on the lookout for a simple brightening clay mask or you need to revamp your entire skin-care routine, the world of beauty is endless. We know it can be hard to decide what products are best for your skin concerns, so we narrowed down the must haves at Ulta. The popular beauty retailer carries a variety of our favorite drugstore brands in addition to high-end skin-care items we can't get enough of. We went on a mission and uncovered some of the best skin-care products at Ulta, so all you have to do is shop below. From names like CeraVe and La Roche-Posay to Kiehl's and Peach & Lily, this lineup features everything you could ever want. If you have acne-prone skin, stock up on pimple patches to fight your zits, and get the editor-favorite Kate Somerville EradiKate Acne Mark Fading Gel to treat acne. Diminish dark spots and hyperpigmentation with the Good Molecules Niacinamide Brightening Toner or the Mad Hippie Vitamin C Serum. On the hunt for a new sunscreen? The Live Tinted Hueguard 3-in-1 Broad Spectrum Mineral SPF 30 is an editor-recommended find that doesn't leave a white cast. Shop our top picks ahead.
author: Anvita Reddy
excerpt: Shop all your favorite affordable and high-end brands.

Whether you're on the lookout for a simple brightening clay mask or you need to revamp your entire skin-care routine, the world of beauty is endless. We know it can be hard to decide what products are best for your skin concerns, so we narrowed down the must haves at Ulta. The popular beauty retailer carries a variety of our favorite drugstore brands in addition to high-end skin-care items we can't get enough of. We went on a mission and uncovered some of the best skin-care products at Ulta, so all you have to do is shop below.

From names like CeraVe and La Roche-Posay to Kiehl's and Peach & Lily, this lineup features everything you could ever want. If you have acne-prone skin, stock up on pimple patches to fight your zits, and get the editor-favorite Kate Somerville EradiKate Acne Mark Fading Gel to treat acne. Diminish dark spots and hyperpigmentation with the Good Molecules Niacinamide Brightening Toner or the Mad Hippie Vitamin C Serum. On the hunt for a new sunscreen? The Live Tinted Hueguard 3-in-1 Broad Spectrum Mineral SPF 30 is an editor-recommended find that doesn't leave a white cast. Shop our top picks ahead.

Best Hydrating Serum at Ulta For Dry Skin

Good Molecules Hyaluronic Acid Serum ($6-$12)

The Good Molecules Hyaluronic Acid Serum is loaded with hyaluronic acid to give your skin a plump appearance. This is ideal for anyone who is dealing with dry skin and sensitivity. Plus, it's extremely affordable.

Best Exfoliating Treatment at Ulta

The Ordinary AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution ($10)

This AHA 30% + BHA 2% Peeling Solution from The Ordinary is powerful and should only be used once a week at night. You only have to keep it on your skin for five to 10 minutes. If you have hyperpigmentation and dark spots, this is a must-have exfoliation treatment.

Best Affordable Cleansing Balm at Ulta

E.l.f. Cosmetics Holy Hydration! Makeup Melting Cleansing Balm ($11)

Get a deep cleanse without stripping your skin with the E.l.f. Cosmetics Holy Hydration! Makeup Melting Cleansing Balm. All you need is a finger scoop to gently melt off makeup, sunscreen, and more. Once you massage it into your skin for one to two minutes, mix in water to properly emulsify it and take the day off.

Best Dark-Spot Treatment at Ulta

Hero Cosmetics Mighty Patch Micropoint for Dark Spot Patches ($13)

If you're dealing with dark spots, the Hero Cosmetics Mighty Patch Micropoint for Dark Spot Patches is an editor pick that promises to fade them within a month. Each patch is soaked with niacinamide, vitamin C, tranexamic, sodium hyaluronate, and skin-soothing ingredients.

Best Dark-Spot Toning Treatment at Ulta

Good Molecules Niacinamide Brightening Toner ($14)

If you're dealing with dark spots and uneven skin tone, the Good Molecules Niacinamide Brightening Toner is something you'll want to incorporate into your routine. It contains niacinamide, arbutin, licorice root extract, and vitamin C. All these ingredients work to diminish hyperpigmentation. It's a gentle, soothing toner that contains no alcohol. You can add a few drops to your cotton pad and swipe it all over your face, or you can add a few drops to the palm of your hands and press it into your skin.

Best Sunscreen at Ulta With No White Cast

Black Girl Sunscreen Moisturizing Sunscreen Lotion SPF 30 ($16)

Keep your skin protected without the white cast with the Black Girl Sunscreen Moisturizing Sunscreen Lotion with SPF 30. It's a chemical-based sunscreen that is so nourishing, you could probably skip moisturizer. It is lightweight and makes your skin feel like skin.

Best Acne Patches at Ulta

COSRX Master Patch Set ($19)

If you have a habit of picking at pimples, handle your breakouts the right way with the COSRX Master Patch Set. It contains 90 hydrocolloid pimple patches that you can use during the day or at night. These patches will absorb excess sebum and treat your pimples without the damage.

Best Cleanser at Ulta For Dry Skin

La Roche-Posay Toleriane Hydrating Gentle Face Cleanser ($20)

La Roche-Posay's Toleriane Hydrating Gentle Face Cleanser will leave your skin cleansed without irritation or stripping it. It has a milky cream texture that will melt off makeup and take the day off. It's a hydrating, soothing cleanser that's perfect for all skin types, including sensitive skin.

Best Hydrating Sleep Mask at Ulta For Sensitive Skin

Bubble Over Night Hydrating Sleep Mask ($20)

Bubble's Over Night Hydrating Sleep Mask is a brightening and hydration treatment approved by editors, especially for those with sensitive skin. It contains mandelic and kojic acids to help exfoliate dead skin cells and arnica to soothe redness. One editor raves that "whenever I use it, my skin feels hydrated, soft, and smooth in the morning." Read her in-depth review of the Bubble Over Night Hydrating Sleep Mask.

Best Retinol Treatment at Ulta

CeraVe Resurfacing Retinol Serum ($22)

Start your retinol journey with the CeraVe Resurfacing Retinol Serum. It will brighten your skin, reduce skin texture, and improve smoothness without being irritating. This is a staple for all skin types.

Best Tinted Lip Balm at Ulta

ILIA Balmy Tint Hydrating Lip Balm ($28)

Give your lips a flush of color while keeping them hydrated with ILIA's Balmy Tint Hydrating Lip Balm. Available in eight flattering shades, this lip balm delivers a sheer coat of pigment that can replace your lip gloss. It has a silky and smooth feel due to the nourishing properties of the sea succulent, rosehip oil, and shea butter in the formula.

Best Acne Treatment at Ulta For Sensitive Skin

Blume Meltdown Acne Oil ($28)

Blume's popular Meltdown Acne Oil is a gentle acne treatment that nourishes the skin rather than drying it out to tackle breakouts. It contains a blend of rosehip, blue tansy, tamanu, and black cumin seed. You can use it as a spot treatment or mix it into your favorite moisturizer or mask for all-over prevention. Read our in-depth review of the Blume Meltdown Acne Oil.

Best Gentle Exfoliating Toner at Ulta For Dry Skin

Good Light Moon Glow Milky Toning Lotion ($28)

The Good Light Moon Glow Milky Toning Lotion is an editor-favorite for hydrating and refreshing skin. It's a lightweight toning treatment that you use after cleansing your face, but before adding serums and moisturizers. It gently exfoliates while infusing your skin with niacinamide, ceramides, and deep hydration from snow mushroom. You can check out our review of the Good Light Moon Glow Milky Toning Lotion for more.

Best Sunscreen For Acne-Prone Skin at Ulta

La Roche-Posay Anthelios UV Correct SPF 70 Daily Face Sunscreen With Niacinamide ($30, originally $38)

If you're in the market for a daily sunscreen that feels and looks elegant on your skin without compromising on broad-spectrum SPF protection, the Anthelios UV Correct SPF 70 Daily Face Sunscreen from La Roche-Posay is a must. This formulation contains niacinamide, which helps balance out the skin and even out your skin tone and texture, so it's great for those who have acne-prone skin or dark spots. It's a chemical sunscreen that is suitable for all skin types as well and won't leave a white cast.

Best Hydrating Hyaluronic Acid-Based Serum at Ulta

Mineral 89 Hyaluronic Acid Face Serum For Stronger Skin ($30)

If you need a boost of hydration, the Vichy Min√©ral 89 Face Serum hydrates, plumps, and fortifies skin with hyaluronic acid and a mineral-rich formula. It's a serum that's perfect for those who deal with dry and dull skin. It's also a great base for makeup.

Best Vitamin C at Ulta

Vichy LiftActiv Vitamin C Brightening Face Serum ($35)

The antioxidant-rich LiftActiv Vitamin C Brightening Face Serum from Vichy is the morning serum that will prevent and protect against the environmental factors you face throughout the day. Along with vitamin C, it's packed with vitamin E, hydrating volcanic water featuring 15 essential minerals, and more. It's lightweight, fast absorbing, and hydrating without leaving a sticky coat on your skin.

Best Clay Mask at Ulta

Origins Clear Improvement Active Charcoal Face Mask to Clear Pores ($36)

Diminish breakouts, clogged pores, and oily skin with the Origins Clear Improvement Active Charcoal Face Mask. This mask has charcoal derived from bamboo ash to help soak up impurities on the skin with the help of kaolin, bentonite, and a white China clay base. This will help balance out your skin while leaving it feeling soft and looking more even.

Best Hydrating Eye Cream at Ulta

Kiehl's Since 1851 Creamy Eye Treatment With Avocado ($38)

Care for your eye area with something nourishing like the Kiehl's Since 1851 Creamy Eye Treatment With Avocado. It's perfect for dry undereyes, especially during the colder months. Using this day and night will give your undereye area a brighter and more awakened look. A little goes a long way!

Best Cleanser at Ulta

Fresh Soy Face Cleanser ($39)

Fresh's Soy Face Cleanser is one of the best gentle cleansers on the market that will leave your skin feeling refreshed and clean yet hydrated. It's a nonstripping foaming wash that removes all the dirt and grime from the day, including makeup and sunscreen, and deeply cleanses the pores. It's great for all skin types as well since it's a hydrating and balancing formula.

Best Gentle, Skin-Refining Serum at Ulta

Peach & Lily Glass Skin Refining Serum ($39)

The Peach & Lily Glass Skin Refining Serum will leave your skin looking dewy and glowing while it hydrates, plumps, calms, and brightens with ease. It contains antioxidants from peach extract and niacinamide, plus it diminishes irritation with centella asiatica extract and Asian mountain yam extract.

Best Moisturizer For Sensitive Skin at Ulta

First Aid Beauty Ultra Repair Cream ($48)

The bestselling First Aid Beauty Ultra Repair Cream will relieve irritation and calm and moisturize the skin. It will restore your moisture barrier and keep it healthy with colloidal oatmeal and allantoin. It's great for all skin types, especially those with dry or sensitive skin.

Best Eye Cream at Ulta For Dry Undereyes

Drunk Elephant Ceramighty AF Eye Balm ($62)

If your undereye area feels dry and looks tired, Drunk Elephant's Ceramighty AF Eye Balm might be the eye cream you need in your arsenal. It has a blend of ceramides, linoleic acid, fatty acids, and antioxidants to help support the skin barrier and soothe, moisturize, and soften the area. "From the moment I apply the formula, it looks as if my undereyes have been given an immediate and dewy new life," one editor says. Read her in-depth review of the Drunk Elephant Ceramighty AF Eye Balm.

Best Luxurious Cleansing Balm at Ulta

Elemis Pro-Collagen Cleansing Balm ($69)

The editor-backed Elemis Pro-Collagen Cleansing Balm has a silky texture that makes removing your makeup a relaxing experience. One editor says the texture starts off as "a gel-like balm but transforms into a milky oil as it's massaged into the skin with water." While $68 may seem like a steep price tag for a cleansing balm, she points out that a little goes a long way, and that she only uses it on days she wears makeup. To see why it's worth it, check out her full review of the Elemis Pro-Collagen Cleansing Balm.

Best Facial Toning Device at Ulta

Nuface Mini+ Facial Toning Microcurrent Kit ($250)

NuFace's microcurrent devices have been a game-changing at-home treatment for shaping and lifting the face. This kit comes with the mini version of the original device, along with the Silk Cr√®me Activator, the Aqua Gel serum, and an application brush. One of our editors tested out the device and says, "I noticed the results in minutes. The right side of my face looked much more sculpted than the left, and even my laugh lines were less pronounced. I didn't even realize that there was such a large difference on my forehead until I saw that my eyebrows looked like they were sitting on two completely different levels of my face." For information and picture proof of this at-home device, read our Nuface facial toning microcurrent device review here.
